channel.title: Comments on: Another WeinbergCloud Update
channel.description: iteration, making, building, and coding in education

item.title: By: Evan Weinberg
item.dc:creator: Evan Weinberg
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2015/10/30/another-weinbergcloud-update/#comment-418">bcphysics</a>.
That two language thing (Python and JS) drove me nuts, and Meteor made such aesthetic sense that I've been thoroughly converted.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to bcphysics.

That two language thing (Python and JS) drove me nuts, and Meteor made such aesthetic sense that I’ve been thoroughly converted.

item.title: By: bcphysics
item.dc:creator: bcphysics
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2015/10/30/another-weinbergcloud-update/#comment-416">Evan Weinberg</a>.
Thanks. I've been learning django but it all gets confusing to me when I start to think about the client side. So after seeing this latest video of yours I decided to start into Meteor, especially since it's now available for windows (which it wasn't when I started with django). It seems that I'll have to use javascript for the client side UI, so why not use javascript for the whole thing.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Evan Weinberg.

Thanks. I’ve been learning django but it all gets confusing to me when I start to think about the client side. So after seeing this latest video of yours I decided to start into Meteor, especially since it’s now available for windows (which it wasn’t when I started with django). It seems that I’ll have to use javascript for the client side UI, so why not use javascript for the whole thing.

item.title: By: Evan Weinberg
item.dc:creator: Evan Weinberg
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2015/10/30/another-weinbergcloud-update/#comment-415">Xavier B.</a>.
Hi Xavier,
I have the whole code base at GitHub - you can see it at https://github.com/emwdx/weinbergCloud . Let me know if you have any questions on how this works.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Xavier B..

Hi Xavier,

I have the whole code base at GitHub – you can see it at https://github.com/emwdx/weinbergCloud . Let me know if you have any questions on how this works.

item.title: By: Evan Weinberg
item.dc:creator: Evan Weinberg
item.description:
Hi Doug,
Glad to hear I can help nudge you along. Meteor provides the framework, but there are a lot of packages that are easily added to an app that add functionality, and I am using a number of them. The big ones involves user management and Bootstrap, but there are some others thrown in. jQuery and Underscore appear to be integral parts of the framework, though they can be removed too.
Available packages can be found through http://atmospherejs.com./
item.content:encoded:
Hi Doug,

Glad to hear I can help nudge you along. Meteor provides the framework, but there are a lot of packages that are easily added to an app that add functionality, and I am using a number of them. The big ones involves user management and Bootstrap, but there are some others thrown in. jQuery and Underscore appear to be integral parts of the framework, though they can be removed too.

Available packages can be found through http://atmospherejs.com/.

item.title: By: Xavier B.
item.dc:creator: Xavier B.
item.description: Do you have this with open source license?
item.content:encoded: Do you have this with open source license?

item.title: By: bcphysics
item.dc:creator: bcphysics
item.description: Looks pretty slick Evan. Your web app inspires me to keep working on my projects! Are you using any javascript frameworks, or is that all from the meteor?
item.content:encoded: Looks pretty slick Evan. Your web app inspires me to keep working on my projects! Are you using any javascript frameworks, or is that all from the meteor?
